classification.notes: Classification describes what Semax is and the general domain where it appears.

status.human_use_note: Not FDA-approved. Human use is reported, including in regions where it has been marketed/used clinically (often intranasal) and in gray-market contexts elsewhere. Product quality and labeling vary in non-regulated markets, increasing uncertainty.

risk.rationale: Overall risk uncertainty is driven by heterogeneous clinical literature (often region-specific), variability in formulations/routes in real-world use, and limited large, modern, independently replicated trials for many claimed outcomes. Potential risks include neuropsychiatric effects, interactions with other CNS-active substances, and unknown long-term safety in adolescents.

overview.title: What it is
overview.text: Semax is a synthetic peptide based on a fragment of ACTH, developed to influence neurotrophic and neuromodulatory pathways in the brain. Published literature includes mechanistic work and clinical reports for cognition/neurologic recovery contexts, but evidence quality varies and many claims lack large, independent replication.

observed_exposure_ranges.notes: Descriptive only. Observed in studies; not instructions.

developmental_risk_block.text: Developmental risk is flagged due to limited adolescent data and uncertain long-term effects. Endocrine, growth, neurodevelopmental, and metabolic setpoints may be sensitive to perturbation. This section is descriptive only; uncertainty is explicitly acknowledged.

evidence.title: [The study of chronic partial denervation and quality of life in patients with motor neuron disease treated with semax].
evidence.notes: Clinical literature is region-specific and heterogeneous; use for boundaries, not claims inflation.

evidence.title: [The efficacy of semax in the tretament of patients at different stages of ischemic stroke].
evidence.notes: Supports mechanism discussion only; not proof of human benefit.
